threat: A remote attacker could exploit this with a specially-crafted request and cause the radvd daemon to crash, or possibly execute arbitrary code.
A local attacker could exploit this to overwrite certain files on the system, bypassing intended permissions.
A remote attacker could exploit this to cause the radvd daemon to crash, resulting in a denial of service.
If used in unicast mode, a remote attacker could cause radvd outages, resulting in a denial of service.
